meanings.definition: A caber is a long, heavy log used in the Scottish sport of caber tossing.
meanings.sent1: During the Highland Games, athletes compete by tossing cabers for distance.
meanings.sent2: The cabers used in caber tossing are carefully selected for their weight and balance.
meanings.sent3: At the caber tossing competition, the cabers decided to have a race instead!
meanings.sent4: The cabers stood tall like ancient trees waiting to be thrown into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the caber hitting the ground echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: Cabers can also refer to the plural form of the word 'caber'.
meanings.sent1: In the field, there were many cabers waiting to be tossed by the competitors.
meanings.sent2: The cabers lined up neatly, ready for the next round of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cabers in the shed whispered to each other about their upcoming adventure.
meanings.sent4: The pile of cabers resembled a forest of possibilities for the athletes.
meanings.sent5: Each of the cabers had its own unique shape and character, adding to the challenge.
